item.title: The Motorcycle Diaries
item.description: (2004) Gael GarcÃ­a Bernal On a break before his last semester of medical school, Ernesto “Che” Guevara (Gael GarcÃ­a Bernal) travels with his friend Alberto Granado (Rodrigo de la Serna) from Brazil to Peru by motorcycle. The two men soon witness the great disparities in South America, encountering poor peasants and observing the exploitation of labor by wealthy industrialists. When they reach a leper colony in Peru, Ernesto’s values have changed so much that he sides with the sufferers, forgetting his own comfort.

item.title: å¤œèˆªè¥¿é£
item.description: A flight to Calgary 1 ‘Oh.’ Ebert looked disappointed, and I knew from his expression that he, as well as the sick man, was lonely for news of the ‘outside’ - news of Nairobi. And in Nairobi people only wanted news of London. Wherever you are, it seems, you must have news of some other place, some bigger place, so that a man on his deathbed in the swamplands of Victoria Nyanza is more interested in what has lately happened in this life than in what may happen in the next.

item.title: $2800 and $20
item.description: 1. He decided to pay $2800 for premium processing. $2800 is quite a lot, but it sets him free. To some extend, money indeed can buy freedom and save time. It was not until a few minutes after he confirmed his decision with the lawyers that he started feeling relieved more than just money-wise ‘calculating’. A few days before making up his mind, he felt frustrated and all disappointment had nowhere to go.

item.title: It's a New Year 2024-2025
item.description: (2024/08/25) Tranquilo Life really does begin at forty. Up until then, you are just doing research. — Carl Jung Meditation Stoic You Don’t Control What Happens, You Control How You Respond. The single most important practice in Stoic philosophy is differentiating between what we can change and what we can’t. Take good care of myself, both physically and mentally. Today is cold. “Es frÃ­o” is used to say that something has a low temperature. hace viento (wendy) llueve (rain) / estÃ¡ lloviendo nieva (snow) / estÃ¡ nevando estÃ¡ nublado / hay nubes estÃ¡ con nevando el climia es templado / tropical / frÃ­o / seco / cÃ¡lido (warm) / hÃºmedo el norte / el oeste (el occidente)/ el sur / el este (oriente) la primavera / el verano / el otoÃ±o / el invierno el volcÃ¡n / la montaÃ±a / la cordillera / el desierto / el rÃ­o / el lago / la selva / el bosque / la costa / la isla / la catarata el centro del paÃ­s casi (almost) 7 millones de habitantes lugares de interÃ©s turÃ­stico la plaza de Armas, el palacio de La Moneda, la iglesia de Santo Domingo AdemÃ¡s de cerveza (besides) ubicaciÃ³n (location, f.

item.title: Curso de EspaÃ±ol A1.1 (6/10)
item.description: Palabra, Frase & OraciÃ³n ir a dormir (go to sleep) Nosotros queremos comer mÃ¡s tarde (later) hoy. Ellas quieren almorzar despÃºes (after) de ir al museo. The Spanish verb â€œto eat lunchâ€ is almorzar. The noun is almuerzo (ahl-MWAIR-so). You notice the Arabic influence of the term in â€œalâ€; in addition, any Spanish spelling with a â€œzâ€ in it is also a hand-me-down from the Arabic languages. Almuerzo has both.

item.title: Curso de EspaÃ±ol A1.1 (5/10)
item.description: Vocabulary otra vez = again flauta = flute periÃ³dico = newspaper cerveza = beer cereza = cherry la comida el arte la vida nocturna la naturaleza la literatura Phrase Tocar la guitarra / la flauta Jugar al ajedrez “Jugar” vs. “Tocar” in Spanish Jugar is used when talking about playing a game or a sport. A mi abuelo le encanta jugar al ajedrez. (My grandpa loves playing chess.) Tocar is used when talking about playing an instrument or performing music.

item.title: Curso de EspaÃ±ol A1.1 (4/10)

(What is that blue thing over there?) Â¿QuÃ© cosas de la lista quieres hacer? (what things in the list you want to do?) escuchar mÃºsica ir a un concierto ver la televisiÃ³n ir a una exposiciÃ³n (exhibition/show) salir de noche (to go out at night, hang out) salir de fiesta salir a cenar (go out for dinner) visitar lugares histÃ³ricos ir al cine cocinar ir de compras (go shopping) ir a la playa (beach) leer jugar a videojuego ir de excursiÃ³n hacer un curso de teatro aprender idiomas / a bailar hablo poco espaÃ±ol (un poco) | poquito So, remember this: poco = amount / pequeÃ±o = size/age.

item.title: Curso de EspaÃ±ol A1.1 (2/10)
item.description: Phrases CÃ³mo se escribe “ventana”? Con ‘b’ o con ‘v’? Hablo un poco de espaÃ±ol The most natural way to say it would be â€œHablo un poco de espaÃ±olâ€. Notice I left â€œyoâ€ out, thatâ€™s something we tend to do with this type of construct. For example: what do you do at the bar? - â€œBebo un tarro de cerveza.â€ As opposed to: â€œYo bebo un tarro de cerveza.â€ Hablo un poquito de espaÃ±ol.

item.title: Curso de EspaÃ±ol A1.1 (1/10)
item.description: 1.Phrase Mucho gusto (tambien)! CÃ³mo te llmas? Me llamo djfan. Mi nombre es djfan. Soy djfan. CÃ³mo se llama tu esposa? Hola, QuÃ© tal? (What’s up?) CÃ³mo estÃ¡s? Buenos dÃ­as (sunrise - noon) Buenas tardes (noon - sunset) Buenas noches - Buena noche (sunset - sunrise) Â¿ Buenas noches o buena noche ? I looked it up and it appears to come from the fact that the Romans divided the night into several watches, 4 I think, hence the plural.

item.title: Back to Hugo in 2024
item.description: 1. Theme Hermit-V2 Hermit-V2 is a minimal and fast theme for Hugo, built for bloggers who want a simple and focused website. This is a maintained fork of Hermit, which iterates over the original work to have a almost-stable experience with bug fixes and new features. run git submodule add -b main https://github.com/1bl4z3r/hermit-V2 themes/hermit-v2 # .gitmodules [submodule "themes/hermit-v2"] path = themes/hermit-v2 url = https://github.com/1bl4z3r/hermit-V2 branch = main Once it’s added, run

item.title: Nomadland
item.description: (2020) Hulu & Searchlight Pictures https://www.imdb.com/title/tt9770150/ https://www.searchlightpictures.com/nomadland/ Director: ChloÃ© Zhao Writers: Jessica Bruder (book), ChloÃ© Zhao (screenplay by) Stars: Frances McDormand Jack Kevorkian Sonnet 18: Shall I compare thee to a summerâ€™s day? (BY WILLIAM SHAKESPEARE) Shall I compare thee to a summerâ€™s day? Thou art more lovely and more temperate: Rough winds do shake the darling buds of May, And summerâ€™s lease hath all too short a date; Sometime too hot the eye of heaven shines, And often is his gold complexion dimm'd; And every fair from fair sometime declines, By chance or natureâ€™s changing course untrimm'd; But thy eternal summer shall not fade, Nor lose possession of that fair thou owâ€™st; Nor shall death brag thou wanderâ€™st in his shade, When in eternal lines to time thou growâ€™st: So long as men can breathe or eyes can see, So long lives this, and this gives life to thee.

item.title: Embed Spotify Link in Hugo
item.description: In my last post, need to find a quick fix to embed a spotify podcast link to a Hugo markdown file. I found this brilliant solution from Ana Ulin. Here we go!

item.title: Hugo Hermit Migration
item.description: I’ve been using Hugo for a while. Previously, I was using a Hugo theme called personal-web. Recently found a neat and tidy, minimalism template Hermit, which more or less motivates me to be more diligent to write & share stuff, anything, either serious or random topics. side story as a New Year resolution I made N (<3) years ago, I’ve been trying to keep the digital life as simple and organized as possible, which was inspired by this summary by NickTalk.
